Divided Attention.description: The state of attending to multiple tasks or stimuli simultaneously.

Reduced Performance.description: Lower quality or quantity of work output due to divided attention.

Increased Error Rate.description: Higher probability of making errors or mistakes due to divided attention.

Decreased Efficiency.description: Reduced productivity and output due to inefficient task switching.

Missed Deadlines.description: Failure to meet deadlines due to impaired focus and multitasking.

Accidents.description: Unintentional events resulting from impaired attention.

Wasted Time.description: Time spent inefficiently due to divided attention.

Resource Inefficiency.description: Inefficient use of resources leading to financial losses.

Negative Consequences.description: Adverse outcomes resulting from missed deadlines.

Stress.description: Mental strain caused by the pressure of multitasking.

Reputational Damage.description: Harm to reputation due to errors.

Property Damage.description: Damage to physical assets due to accidents.

Procrastination.description: Delaying tasks due to difficulty focusing.

Frustration.description: Negative emotional state due to inefficiency.

Increased Costs.description: Higher expenses due to resource inefficiency.

Reduced Profitability.description: Lower profits due to decreased efficiency.

Job Loss.description: Termination of employment due to poor performance.

Anxiety.description: Feeling of worry and unease due to stress.

Burnout.description: State of emotional, physical, and mental exhaustion.
